CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, April 30, 1949, pg. 3 reads: "Big Dope Haul - Enough 'reefers' to make almost 6,000 dope users 'high' is in that suitcase being watched by Patrolman Oliver Mason, left, and Plainclothesman Ray Miller after they nabbed the big marihuana [marijuana] haul in Pittsburgh, Pa. Fred Moore, below, 30-year-old unemployed musician, was the man who reportedly owned the 'dream dust.'  The bag contains fifteen pounds, enough to make 12,000 'reefers.' - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Plain clothes police officer Ray Miller, suspect Fred Moore, police patrolman Oliver Mason, standing before court bench with opened suitcase with bundles of marijuana
